text: Richard Edward Cavazos (January 31, 1929 – October 29, 2017), was a United States Army four-star general. He was a Korean War recipient of the Distinguished Service Cross as a first lieutenant. He advanced in rank to become the United States Army's first Hispanic four-star general.Celebrating Hispanic Heritage . During the Vietnam War, as a lieutenant colonel, Cavazos was awarded a second Distinguished Service Cross. In 1976, Cavazos became the first Mexican American to reach the rank of brigadier general in the U.S. Army.Hispanic Heritage Biographies. Cavazos served for thirty-three years, with his final command as head of the U.S. Army Forces Command. Cavazos died at the age of 88 in San Antonio, Texas on October 29, 2017 from complications of Alzheimer's disease.Cavazos, the Army’s first Hispanic four-star general, dies in S.A. at 88 ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Texas Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:American military personnel of the Korean War Category:Military people from Texas
